metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35788 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fl_set_geneve_opt in net/sched/cls_flower.c inthe Linux kernel before 6.3.7. It allows an out-of-bounds write in theflower classifier code via TCA_FLOWER_KEY_ENC_OPTS_GENEVE packets. This mayresult in denial of service or privilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-76-generic - 5.15.0-76.83
linux-image-5.15.0-76-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-76.83
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-76-generic - 5.15.0-76.83
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-76-generic-64k - 5.15.0-76.83
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-46-generic - 5.19.0-46.47~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-46.47~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-76.83').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-46.47~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1037.42').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1039.44').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1041.48').
linux-azure-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-6.2, was needs-triage').
